title: React doesn't re-render DOM after manual DOM tree and key prop changes
body:
<!--
  Note: if the issue is about documentation or the website, please file it at:
  https://github.com/reactjs/reactjs.org/issues/new
-->

**Do you want to request a *feature* or report a *bug*?**

A bug.

**What is the current behavior?**

In the real world I used https://github.com/RubaXa/Sortable to sort array items. When I d'n'd an item I send a new sorting state to a server. It's OK when the server responds  with the same data I've sent but if the server rejects sorting and sends me the data I had in the beginning, array items don't sort back.

**If the current behavior is a bug, please provide the steps to reproduce and if possible a minimal demo of the problem via https://jsfiddle.net or similar (template for React 16: https://jsfiddle.net/Luktwrdm/, template for React 15: https://jsfiddle.net/hmbg7e9w/).**

I have simulated d'n'd sorting programmatically by flipping DOM nodes via DOM interface.

https://jsfiddle.net/Luktwrdm/60/

- DOM is rendered using given state (A, B).
- I flip DOM nodes in 2 seconds (B, A).
- And set a new state which is the same as it was on the first step (B, A).

`key={id}` or `key={id + index}` don't help there. 
 
**What is the expected behavior?**

It should sort nodes back (A, B).

**Which versions of React, and which browser / OS are affected by this issue? Did this work in previous versions of React?**

React 16. The issue also appears in React 15 https://jsfiddle.net/hmbg7e9w/1/
